metadata.notes: Delivered shortly after the election of Jimmy Carter (1976). Focuses on spiritual warfare and the 'sifting' of Peter.

freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.score_explanation: 10 = Completely free from coercive judgments. 0 = Very dominant Critical Parent.
freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.analysis: The CP manifests through warnings of an 'awful enemy' and commands to 'not drowse.' It uses fear of the devil to enforce church attendance.
quotes: If you are not careful, the devil will get hold of you.
Do not settle back and loll around. Miss church one Sunday and you feel less guilty, until it is easy to miss and hard to go.

healthy_care_NP.score_explanation: 10 = Healthy, non-smothering care. 0 = Absent or smothering.
healthy_care_NP.analysis: The preacher uses a warm, Nurturing Parent tone to reassure the 'boys and girls' (congregation) of God's grace despite their 'shabby service.'
quotes: I am always overborne and shattered within when I think of how the good Lord of us all takes our poor, clumsy efforts and accepts them so warmly.

adult.analysis: The Adult is present in the historical/political analysis of the 1976 election and the linguistic distinction between 'unworthy' and 'unworthily.' However, it is often bypassed by appeals to mystical 'shudders.'
quotes: In our recent election, you can be sure that the strategists for both sides devised a plan of victory.
'Unworthy' means 'not of sufficient merit.' 'Unworthily' means 'without due reverence...'

freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.score_explanation: 10 = Free from fear/compliance. 0 = Strong Adapted Child (fear culture).
freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.analysis: The preacher models the Adapted Child by describing himself as 'shabby' and 'half-hearted' before the Parent-God, inviting the congregation to feel similarly small.
quotes: How he has taken the half-hearted loyalty, the mixed motives, the shabby service...

free_child_FC.analysis: Authentic joy appears in the 'coronation anthem' section, showing a Free Child's capacity for wonder and celebration.
quotes: And in that blessed shout I shall still praise him.
I shall wonder and praise him for that straight to the gates of everlasting day.

ego_positions_scan.dominant_ego_position: Nurturing Parent shifting to Critical Parent

transaction_analysis.analysis: The preacher primarily occupies a Parent role (both Nurturing and Critical), addressing the congregation as 'my people' or 'boys and girls,' placing them in a dependent Child position.
transaction_analysis.ulterior_motives: Social: 'I am teaching you about Peter.' Psychological: 'You are weak and in danger, but I (and God) will protect you if you stay in line.'
transaction_analysis.risk_explanation: The 'Bait and Switch' risk: The sermon begins with grace (NP) but moves into a warning that missing church leads to the devil's grasp (CP).

detected_games.name: ITHY (I'm Only Trying To Help You)

formula_g_analysis.con: God accepts your 'shabby service' and I am here to comfort you.
formula_g_analysis.gimmick: The listener's sense of inadequacy and fear of the 'cunning adversary.'
formula_g_analysis.switch: The shift from God's acceptance to the demand for 'watching' and 'standing fast' or the devil will get you.
formula_g_analysis.payoff: The listener feels both relieved and perpetually anxious/dependent on the institution.
evidence_quotes: I have come today armed with the authority to say to you that you are not in this fight by yourself.

formula_g_analysis.con: Modern people don't understand the 'mystery of evil.'
formula_g_analysis.gimmick: The congregation's feeling of being 'outsiders' or 'stepchildren of privilege.'
formula_g_analysis.switch: Moving from political plans to the 'murky region where evil does its work.'
formula_g_analysis.payoff: A collective sense of being a 'persecuted remnant' which reinforces group cohesion through fear.
evidence_quotes: Twentieth-century people do not take favorably to this old biblical idea...
We are up against an awful enemy.

games_analysis.absence_of_games_analysis: Authenticity is maintained only in the linguistic Adult analysis of the Greek/Biblical terms, which momentarily treats the listener as an intellectual equal.

preacher_roles.rescuer: High: The preacher 'arms himself with authority' to deliver the message of protection.
preacher_roles.persecutor: Low-Medium: Manifests when warning about the 'devil getting hold' of those who miss church.
preacher_roles.victim: Low: Briefly appears when the preacher describes his own 'shabby service' to build rapport.

drama_triangle_analysis.congregation_position: Victim: The congregation is portrayed as 'sluggish, half-hearted' and 'sifted' by a powerful Satan, needing the Rescuer.
drama_triangle_analysis.escape_possibilities: The Adult analysis of 'unworthily' offers a small escape into objective reality, but it is quickly subsumed by the Drama of the 'awful enemy.'

conclusion_and_recommendation.summary: The sermon is psychologically complex. It uses a Nurturing Parent voice to offer comfort, but this comfort is predicated on a Child-like dependency. By emphasizing the 'shabbiness' of the human effort and the 'cunning' of the devil, it keeps the listener in a state of 'Adapted Child' fear. The move to link church attendance directly to demonic vulnerability is a classic 'Game' move (ITHY/NIGYSOB) that uses guilt to ensure compliance.
strengths: Strong Adult-level biblical exposition regarding the word 'unworthily.'
High emotional resonance and use of Free Child imagery in the 'coronation' section.
areas_for_improvement: Reduction of 'Critical Parent' threats regarding church attendance.
Moving away from describing the congregation as 'sluggish' or 'shabby' to promote Adult autonomy.
conclusion_and_recommendation.advice_for_game_free_communication: Try to address the congregation's capacity for 'Adult' spiritual discipline rather than 'Child' fear of the devil. Replace 'If you are not careful, the devil will get you' with 'As Adult believers, we can choose to stay alert.'
